questions.question: After he …………………………….. his exams, he went to Asia for a month.
questions.description: Either the simple past or the past perfect can be used here.

questions.question: I wish I ………………………….. curly hair.
questions.description: A simple past is used after I wish to express regrets.

questions.question: Ten o’clock – it is time you ……………………………………… to bed.
questions.description: A simple past is used after it is time to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: Don’t come and see me tomorrow. I would rather you …………………………… on Monday.
She ……………………………… jobless for six months.
questions.description: A present perfect is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: That is the third banana you ……………………………… this morning.
questions.description: The present perfect is used in this structure.

questions.question: I ………………………………… two rooms since lunchtime.
questions.description: The present perfect puts emphasis on the idea of completion.

questions.question: I …………………………….. all afternoon.
questions.description: The present perfect continuous puts emphasis on the idea of continuity.

questions.question: He ………………………….. ill last week.
questions.description: Use the simple past to say when something happened.

questions.question: He …………………………….. ill for more than a week.
